definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: Her feelings of affection are dormant but easily awakened.
sentences.chinese: 她的鐘愛之情蟄伏着但很容易被喚醒。

sentences.english: But light struggled with dark in Nixon's soul.
sentences.chinese: 然而，光明與黑暗的對決卻蟄伏於他的內心深處。

sentences.english: We stay in the room, door closed, lights out.
sentences.chinese: 我們蟄伏在房間裏，門關閉着，燈熄滅了。

sentences.english: Black bears are now considered highly efficient hibernators.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，人們以爲黑熊是就寢效率最高的蟄伏動物。

sentences.english: Many will die off with the first frost whilst others hibernate until the following spring.
sentences.chinese: 很多會在初霜之時死去，其他的則會蟄伏到來年春天。

sentences.english: Some insects slumber in the winter.
Throughout the winter, warm, such as dormant Maemi, Yaran in the permafrost of the groove back.
sentences.chinese: 整個冬天，熱情如蟄伏的鳴蟬，啞然於凍土的溝回。

sentences.english: Between dormant in the distant arctic ice devil, to follow my call to come.
sentences.chinese: 在遙遠極寒之處蟄伏的冰雪魔神，順從我的召喚前來。

sentences.english: We stay in the room, door closed, lights out .
sentences.chinese: 蟄伏在房間裏，門關閉着，燈熄滅了。

sentences.english: The pupae remain dormant in the soil until they emerge as adult moths in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 蛹蟄伏在土壤中，直到冬天它們才蛻變成蛾子飛出來。

definition: insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
